what's with all the negative reviews?  i don't get it!  I had a great experience.  Good thing i tried it for myself and not get influenced by the previous reviews.First off - the building housing this restaurant is spectacular - so the setting was a treat in itself.Second - the service was gracious, friendly & prompt.  And though my friends (who did all the ordering) are native barcelonans and could navigate between castellano & catalan seamlessly, the servers joked around with me in their broken english... no snobbery whatsoever.  Food:  we had the baby lamb as the main course - sooo good.  I'd never had such young lamb before - and this meat was tender and just fell off the bone.  And the blood sausage (I can't believe i'm about to admit this) was the best thing ever.  Sometimes i just abandon my food issues, and adopt that Anthony Bourdain philosophy of just going for it & trying what the locals eat.  I'm glad i did - because although i've had awful blood sausage (murcillo) in the past - this one was so delicious, i ate the last piece on the dish.The place is expensive, but considering the whole - presentation, setting, food, quality - i think it was priced accordingly.  definitely good for a special occasion.  especially if you like lamb.
